text: - My name is Luis Correia,

and I'm a Technical Consultant
at Devoteam A Cloud.
The team I work for is based in Berlin
and it helps our customers adopt
and use AWS Cloud solutions.
I had a pretty long professional journey
before I started my career in the cloud.

So my academic background is
in agricultural engineering,

I worked in research
and development groups
for several universities.
I then worked as a cook,
and afterwards as an online travel agent
in a customer support center.
I was at the crossroad between my age

and all the things I felt
I needed to do in life.

At the time, I knew very
little about cloud computing
although I had friends in the IT industry,
I was hesitant but then I realized

that cloud was not only
for people with a technical
or developer background.
I started my learning journey

with AWS re/Start
Training Program in Berlin
from Digital Career Institute.

The AWS re/Start Training
gave me a good overview
of the AWS ecosystem.
It allowed me to get into IT
without having a background
on programming languages,
networking, database administration,
all those skills that you learn
in a computer science major, for example.

And it also worked in a
very high level perspective

of components, especially
the architectural part of it
so that you connect components

in order to achieve the goal
that you or your client wants.

I do have a passion for
building synthesizers,
the way you combine

and choose different
components for given sound
remind me a lot of cloud computing

where you put multiple
components together.
In cloud computing,

you can be an expert in
individual components
or you can learn what components work best

to achieve a certain goal
or a certain sound in music.
I also realized that my previous personal

and professional experiences
would not be an obstacle

but rather would help me be
competitive in the job market.

The certified cloud
practitioner certification

was the first feather in my
cap and it opened doors for me,

and it was something that
helped me put face-to-face
with potential employers.
It served as a badge of credibility
and I felt more confident
during my interviews with employers.
The whole journey had a tremendous impact
on my family, life, and relationships,

it helped me get out
of a rut that I was in.

The re/Start Program
was actually at the core
of a lot of changes, important changes
during this period in my life.

I started working for
Devoteam earlier this year,

and since then I've also
achieved AWS solutions architect
and developer associate certifications.
